title: How to Make a Bug Vacuum

steps.headline: Method One of Two: This method has you suck the bug into the cup
Get a piece of really fine mesh.
Cut two round holes in the cup and stick the tubes in them.
Tape all around the tubes so that they cannot fall out.
Put the mesh over one of the tubes.
steps.description: You must put the mesh on the part of the tube that is inside the cup.

steps.headline: Get some plastic wrap and put it over the open end of the cup.
Put the end of the tube (the one with the mesh on the end) in your mouth.
Put the other tube where the bug is.
Suck in air with your mouth.
Watch the bug crawl around in side your cup.
Method Two of Two: This method has you squeeze a bulb and the bug goes into the chamber
Get a baby bulb.
steps.description: If you don't know what it is, Google the image. It's a bulb with a syringe at one end, but you don't have to use one of these, any squeeze bulb will do, it just needs one hole.

steps.headline: Get a drinking straw.
steps.description: Any straw will do, you can cut it to make it shorter if you want.

steps.headline: Attach the straw firmly to the hole in the bulb.
steps.description: You may need to cut the bulb to make it fit. You want the straw to fit inside the bulb, not outside.

steps.headline: Try it out!
steps.description: When you squeeze the bulb and let go, air should rush in, and ants will too! Since you're using a drinking straw, you won't be able to fit large bugs in, but ant and fly size will fit.

steps.headline: OPTIONAL: Get a small plastic container, one that you won't be using again.
steps.description: It should be around the size of a hotel shampoo bottle. Fill it with bug spray, or anything that can kill bugs. You can empty out your bulb into this container, leaving the bugs to drown.

text: Method One of Two: This method has you suck the bug into the cup  Get a clear cup.  Get two clear tubes.  Get a piece of really fine mesh.  Cut two round holes in the cup and stick the tubes in them.  Tape all around the tubes so that they cannot fall out.  Put the mesh over one of the tubes. You must put the mesh on the part of the tube that is inside the cup. Get some plastic wrap and put it over the open end of the cup.  Go find a bug.  Put the end of the tube (the one with the mesh on the end) in your mouth.  Put the other tube where the bug is.  Suck in air with your mouth.  Watch the bug crawl around in side your cup.  Method Two of Two: This method has you squeeze a bulb and the bug goes into the chamber  Get a baby bulb. If you don't know what it is, Google the image. It's a bulb with a syringe at one end, but you don't have to use one of these, any squeeze bulb will do, it just needs one hole. Get a drinking straw. Any straw will do, you can cut it to make it shorter if you want. Attach the straw firmly to the hole in the bulb. You may need to cut the bulb to make it fit. You want the straw to fit inside the bulb, not outside. Try it out! When you squeeze the bulb and let go, air should rush in, and ants will too! Since you're using a drinking straw, you won't be able to fit large bugs in, but ant and fly size will fit. OPTIONAL: Get a small plastic container, one that you won't be using again. It should be around the size of a hotel shampoo bottle. Fill it with bug spray, or anything that can kill bugs. You can empty out your bulb into this container, leaving the bugs to drown.
